description: Roasted poblano peppers are stuffed with a mixture of red beans and chile verde rice before being drizzled in rich cumin-lime cashew crema to make this flavorful vegan meal.
keywords: Cumin-Lime Cashew Crema, stuffed peppers, Stuffed Poblano Peppers, Stuffed Poblano Peppers with Cumin-Lime Cashew Crema
name: Stuffed Poblano Peppers with Cumin-Lime Cashew Crema
recipeIngredient: 1 6-ounce package Lundberg Family Farms Organic Sprouted Chile Verde Rice
1 14-ounce can kidney beans, drained and rinsed
1 cup raw cashews (soaked in water 4 to 8 hours, drained and rinsed)

recipeInstructions.text: In a small saucepan, combine the water and the contents of the Chile Verde Rice package, including the rice and seasoning packet. Place the saucepan over high heat and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and bring to a simmer. Cover and cook for 35 minutes. Remove from heat and let the rice sit, covered, for 5 minutes more.

While the rice cooks, preheat the oven to 400Â°F. Lightly rub the pepper halves with olive oil and arrange, cut side down, on a baking sheet. Bake until the peppers are tender and their skins begin to blister, 16 to 18 minutes.
Uncover the rice and fluff a few times with a fork. Stir in the beans, cilantro and green onion.
